poem:
Title: Caught In The Act of Seeing

A morning of fractured marble,
of limbs twisted in cold, eternal dance,
Esteban holds the day, photographic laurel.
Capturing beauty by pure chance,

in St Ermin's sepia reflection,
in Soane's silent, stone-walled collection.
He hears Elinor's echo, photograph,
and follows the path,

so is the image a solicitation,
or a moment of still celebration?
One can ponder or simply admire,
in the frozen fire of desire.
